page.title: 10St.Andrew's Quarry
page.content: The limestone rock was first excavated by hand. It was used in the building of Barry Docks and older houses in the Dinas Powys area. During the 17th Century a rocky outcrop above the quarry became the favourite seat of Hugh LLoyd after he was replaced as Rector of St.Andrew's Church during the Commonwealth. This became known as {'Cadair Yr Esgob'}(The Bishop's Seat) as LLoyd became Bishop of LLandaff after the Restoration. This century the quarry closed down due to bankruptcy. Presently the site is used as a landscape gardening centre but there are plans to re-open it as a quarry. Public opposition has delayed this due to the large amount of heavy traffic the quarry would generate to pass through the centre of Dinas Powys.
